note.title: KinectFusion Real-Time Dense Surface Mapping and Tracking

links.alias: Incremental calculation (combine depth image one by one)

surface-prediction-from-ray-casting-the-.text: Surface Prediction from Ray Casting the TSDF

pageProps.body:
KinectFusion Real-Time Dense Surface Mapping and Tracking

Surface Measurement

Notations

  • Tg,k\bm{T}_{g,k}Tg,k​: camera pose at time kkk (Tg,k\bm{T}_{g,k}Tg,k​ is camera Model Matrix, Tg,k−1\bm{T}_{g,k}^{-1}Tg,k−1​ is camera View Matrix)
  • KKK: camera intrinsic matrix
  • pk\bm{p}_kpk​: point in camera frame at time kkk
  • pg\bm{p}_gpg​: point in world frame
  • q=π(p)\bm{q} = \pi(\bm{p})q=π(p): point in image frame (hnormalized)
  • RkR_kRk​: Raw depth map at time kkk
  • u=(u,v)\bm{u} = (u, v)u=(u,v): image pixel
  • u˙=[uT∣1]T\dot{\bm{u}} = [\bm{u}^T|1]^Tu˙=[uT∣1]T: image pixel in homogenous coordinate
  • Rk(u)R_k(\bm{u})Rk​(u): depth value at pixel u\bm{u}u

Known relations

pg=Tg,kpk\bm{p}_g = \bm{T}_{g,k} \bm{p}_kpg​=Tg,k​pk​
pk=Rk(u)K−1u˙\bm{p}_k = R_k(\bm{u})\bm{K}^{-1}\dot{\bm{u}}pk​=Rk​(u)K−1u˙

Steps

  1. Apply Bilateral filter to obtain denoised depth map DkD_kDk​
  2. Back-project filtered depth to obtain vertex map Vk(u)=Dk(u)K−1u˙\bm{V}_k(\bm{u}) = D_k(\bm{u})\bm{K}^{-1}\dot{\bm{u}}Vk​(u)=Dk​(u)K−1u˙
  3. Compute normal map Nk(u)=normalized((V(u+1,v)−V(u,v))×(V(u,v+1)−V(u,v)))\bm{N}_k(\bm{u}) = normalized((\bm{V}(u+1, v) - \bm{V}(u, v))\times(\bm{V}(u, v+1)- \bm{V}(u, v)))Nk​(u)=normalized((V(u+1,v)−V(u,v))×(V(u,v+1)−V(u,v)))
  4. Compute binary mask map Mk\bm{M}_kMk​ for valid vertices
  5. Computer 3 level vertex normal map pyramid via mipmapping DkD_kDk​

Mapping as Surface Reconstruction

Notations

  • Fk(pg)F_k(\bm{p}_g)Fk​(pg​): truncated signed distance value
  • Wk(pg)W_k(\bm{p}_g)Wk​(pg​): weight
  • Sk(pg)\bm{S}_k(\bm{p}_g)Sk​(pg​): TSDF
  • μ\muμ: measure uncertainty
  • rrr: distance from camera center along depth ray
  • λ=∥K−1u˙∥2\lambda = \| \bm{K}^{-1} \dot{\bm{u}} \|_2λ=∥K−1u˙∥2​: distance along depth ray (distance between projected u\bm{u}u and camera center)

IMPORTANT Unproject image point is depth ambiguous

TSDF representation

  1. Region within uncertainty measurement: ∣r−λRk(u)∣≤μ|r - \lambda R_k(\bm{u})| \leq \mu∣r−λRk​(u)∣≤μ
  2. Region within visible space but at distance greater than μ\muμ: μ\muμ
  3. Non-visible points further than μ\muμ: null

Projective TSDF

  • Easy to compute and trivially parallelizable
  • Approximation but converges to SDF

Given raw depth map RkR_kRk​ with known pose Tg,k\bm{T}_{g, k}Tg,k​, for pg\bm{p}_gpg​ in global frame, compute

Ψ(λ−1∥tg,k−pg∥2−Rk(x))\Psi(\lambda^{-1} \|\bm{t}_{g, k} - \bm{p}_g\|_2 - R_k(\bm{x}))Ψ(λ−1∥tg,k​−pg​∥2​−Rk​(x))
  1. Project pg\bm{p}_gpg​ into depth image coordinate to find closet pixel (⌊.⌋\lfloor . \rfloor⌊.⌋ denotes nearest neighbour lookup)
    x=⌊π(KTg,k−1pg)⌋\bm{x} = \lfloor \pi(\bm{K} \bm{T}_{g, k}^{-1} \bm{p}_g) \rfloorx=⌊π(KTg,k−1​pg​)⌋
  2. Distance to camera center
    λ=∥K−1x˙∥2\lambda = \|\bm{K}^{-1} \dot{\bm{x}} \|_2λ=∥K−1x˙∥2​
  3. Distance between pg,k\bm{p}_{g, k}pg,k​ and camera position in global frame
    ∥tg,k−pg∥2\|\bm{t}_{g, k} - \bm{p}_g\|_2∥tg,k​−pg​∥2​
  4. Compute projective signed distance
    λ−1∥tg,k−pg∥2−Rk(x)\lambda^{-1} \|\bm{t}_{g, k} - \bm{p}_g\|_2 - R_k(\bm{x})λ−1∥tg,k​−pg​∥2​−Rk​(x)
  5. Truncate signed distance as describe in TSDF representation. Note its is scale so that non-trucated values before/after zero crossing are stored in discrete volume
    Ψ(η)={min⁡(1,ημ)sgn(η)iff η≥−μnullotherwise\Psi(\eta) = \begin{cases} \min(1, \frac{\eta}{\mu}) sgn(\eta) &\text{iff}\ \eta \geq -\mu \\ \text{null} &\text{otherwise} \end{cases}Ψ(η)={min(1,μη​)sgn(η)null​iff η≥−μotherwise​
  6. Wk(pg)W_k(\bm{p}_g)Wk​(pg​) is proportional to cos⁡θ/Rk(x)\cos\theta / R_k(\bm{x})cosθ/Rk​(x), where θ\thetaθ is angle between ray and surface normal

Global fusion

Apply Incremental calculation (combine depth image one by one) pointwise for {p∣Fk(p)≠null}\{\bm{p}|F_k(\bm{p}) \neq \text{null}\}{p∣Fk​(p)=null} (unmeasurable region is not updated)

  • Unit weight is good enough
  • Truncate updated weight allow moving average reconstruction
  • Fuse raw depth map as smoothed one removes the high frequency structure

Surface Prediction from Ray Casting the TSDF

  • Apply per pixel raycast. For ray Tg,kK−1u˙\bm{T}_{g, k} \bm{K}^{-1} \dot{\bm{u}}Tg,k​K−1u˙, start at minimum depth and stops at zero crossing (front / back) or exit volume
  • Surface normal is estimated with the numerical gradient of iso-surface
  • March faster with trucated value as non-trucated value must exist before zero crossing, as it is guaranteed by trucate function scaling
  • If Ft+F^{+}_tFt+​ and Ft+Δt+F^{+}_{t + \Delta t}Ft+Δt+​ are at either side of zero crossing, approximate interpolation point with linear interpolation
    t∗=t−ΔtFt+Ft+Δt+−Ft+t^{*} = t - \frac{\Delta t F_t^{+}}{F^{+}_{t + \Delta t} - F_t^{+}}t∗=t−Ft+Δt+​−Ft+​ΔtFt+​​

TODO

  • Is ∥K−1u˙∥2Rk(u)\| \bm{K}^{-1} \dot{\bm{u}} \|_2 R_k(\bm{u})∥K−1u˙∥2​Rk​(u) equivalent to ∥K−1[uRk(u),vRk(u),Rk(u)]T∥2\|\bm{K}^{-1}[u R_k(\bm{u}), vR_k(\bm{u}), R_k(\bm{u})]^T\|_2∥K−1[uRk​(u),vRk​(u),Rk​(u)]T∥2​?
  • Surface normal in fusion
  • Min/max block acceleration
  • Ray/trilinear cell intersection

noteIndex.title: Root
noteIndex.body:
My personal knowledge cache using [Dendron](https://www.dendron.so)

## History
It was during my first job, at the start-up company called PixelShift.AI, that I acquired most prominent skill as a software engineer-the ability to read source code. It opened up a new way of learning and my knowledge expanded rapidly ever since. Learning new things is thriving but noting them down cogently and organized is hard. I often found myself forget the context few month later, making the notes completely intelligible. Additionally, some notes need frequent update as my previous understanding could be parochial, antiquated or even erroneous.

In desperate attempt to facilitate the noting/updating experience, I came across [Dendron](https://www.dendron.so) and found it surprisingly congenial to my personal need. With it, I have gradually grown the habit of caching, linking back and extending my knowledge base.

## Disclaimer
The notes are collections of information I found along the journey. I use backquote to denote sources, but I am likely to miss some references, so apology in advance. Also, they are my personal understandings, usually added when I first encounter the topic and will be updated only when I come across it again, so some of them could be incomplete or wrong.
